info.author: Abhinav Gupta
info.description:
=====
Polls
=====

Polls is a simple Django app to conduct Web-based polls. For each
question, visitors can choose between a fixed number of answers.

Built in Django Version 1.6

Created using these series of 6 tutorials : https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.6/intro/tutorial01

Quick start
-----------

1. Add "polls" to your INSTALLED_APPS setting like this::

      INSTALLED_APPS = (
          ...
          'polls',
      )

2. Include the polls URLconf in your project urls.py like this::

      url(r'^polls/', include('polls.urls')),

3. Run `python manage.py syncdb` to create the polls models.

4. Start the development server and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/
   to create a poll (you'll need the Admin app enabled).

5. Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/polls/ to participate in the poll.
info.name: django-polls-simple
info.summary: Web-based polls using a simple,easy-to-use Django app.
info.html_description:
Polls is a simple Django app to conduct Web-based polls. For each question, visitors can choose between a fixed number of answers.

Built in Django Version 1.6

Created using these series of 6 tutorials : https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.6/intro/tutorial01

Quick start

  1. Add “polls” to your INSTALLED_APPS setting like this:

    INSTALLED_APPS = (
    ...
    'polls',
)

  2. Include the polls URLconf in your project urls.py like this:

    url(r'^polls/', include('polls.urls')),

  3. Run python manage.py syncdb to create the polls models.

  4. Start the development server and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/ to create a poll (you’ll need the Admin app enabled).

  5. Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/polls/ to participate in the poll.
